intro: Xylothermia montana, commonly known as the mountain xylotherm, is a rare and specialized plant found in high-altitude environments. It belongs to the family Xylothermaceae and is characterized by its unique adaptations to cold and arid conditions. The plant exhibits a compact growth form with thick, waxy leaves that help reduce water loss. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of subtle colors. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, Xylothermia montana is considered a sensitive indicator of alpine ecosystem health.
